conclusion: The problem asks to predict whether liquid from openings A, B, C, and D will flow into container E or F after passing through baffles.
The image shows four openings at the top labeled A, B, C, and D, and two containers at the bottom labeled E and F.
The image contains baffles inclined at different angles between the openings and the containers.
The baffle below opening A is inclined to the left.
The baffles below openings B, C, and D are inclined to the right.
The inclination of the baffle below opening A directs liquid from A to the left-hand collection channel leading to container E.
The inclination of the baffles below openings B, C, and D directs liquid from these openings to the right-hand collection channel leading to container F.
Liquid from opening A ends up in container E.
Liquids from openings B, C, and D all end up in container F.
